{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amniotic fluid is mainly produced by the fetus. The fetus produces urine, which is the primary source of amniotic fluid. The amniotic fluid also contains other substances such as fetal lung secretions and skin cells. The placenta, chorion, and amnion play important roles in supporting and protecting the fetus, but they do not directly produce amniotic fluid.", "answer_choice": "B"}
